result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob G. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob G. Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob G. Larson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob G. Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per Amy at ONSO in custody ONSO

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob G. Larson
Current: 727 Brunner St, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2016)
Prior: 138 Maple Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501
Notified Nicole - defendant made up payments and reinstated payment plan -
Informed Mr. Larson he needs to catch up missed payments to cancel warrant.    $50 Feb, $50, Mar & $50 April
VIOLATED PAYMENT PLAN
Notified Mary - payment plan set up
Defendant has requested court quash warrant with payment of $60.00 ($50 towards fine & $10.00 payment plan fee) Judge O'Melia will allow.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:52
State moves to dismiss counts 2-4 - Granted - Voorhees statement to property recovered - tool box belonged to him - asked to have it returned- Plea questionnaire filed - No contest plea to count 1-  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court imposes CC/CV/DNAAS - $443.00 total - 
Appeal rights given 
within 30 days - DA is to establish whether the Tool box/tools are part of investigation or if should be returned to defendant -   payment plan given to be in by 9-14  Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Notified Mary at ONSO - warrant issued in error; voluntary appearance prior to warrant being issued

01:07 pm - Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar states close to resolution.  Court questions defendant as to non-apperance.  Defendant states just started new job at Culvers - forgot the court date.  Court quashes warrant - not yet issued.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Voluntary appearance at 07-23-2015 11:45 am

03:41 pm - Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees states has not had contact with defendant on today's date.  Currently on Extended Supervision.  Court authorizes warrant.

02:49 pm - Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states has had discussions and defendant has paid restitution up front.  There is another case not charged out by the State - Close to resolution - Joint request for another pretrial conference.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

01:45 pm - Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to non-appearance.  Defendant states spaced out the date - was at work.  Schiek/Voorhees request adjournment to finalize details of agreement.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Voluntary appearance at 04-30-2015 01:15 pm

10:52 am - Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees states does not know why defendant isn't present - is on Extended Supervision.  There is a resolution in place - needs to discuss with defendant.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:36
In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 10:45 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
May not be on any Walmart premises

01:36 pm - Defendant Jacob G. Larson in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
